issue.title: [Docs] Add Dockerfile for reproducible documentation generation
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-905](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-905). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
We want to make sure that any committer can update the documentation on http://arrow.apache.org/. Since development environments may vary, it would be useful to have a point-of-truth bash script or Dockerfile for building all of the project API documentation for upload to the website.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-905?focusedCommentId=16097895) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Updating the generated documentation on the website is a bit laborious / manual at the moment. Along with streamlining packaging for native libraries, we should also make it as simple and portable as possible to update the documentation. A committer will still have to commit and push any changes to arrow-site, though.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-905?focusedCommentId=16151941) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
As nice as this would be, it is not too much of a hardship to update the docs manually the next couple releases. Moved off 0.7.0
